intro: Porostema guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan porostema, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Porostema guianensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
